snippet: Four young memoirists, including Steven Rinella, author of “Meat Eater,” have largely taken to hunting, they say, for ethical reasons.
abstract: Dwight Garner Critic's Notebook on new breed of American hunter-gathers: young writers, who have largely taken to hunting, they say, for ethical reasons; their memoirs share the thoughts of non-macho meat eaters who shoot their own food as a way to connect to, and be thankful for, their meals.
lead_paragraph: Four young memoirists, including Steven Rinella, author of “Meat Eater,” have largely taken to hunting, they say, for ethical reasons.

headline.seo: New Breed of Hunter Shoots, Eats and Writes
headline.main: A New Breed of Hunter Shoots, Eats and Tells
headline.print_headline: A New Breed of Hunter Shoots, Eats and Tells
